de.charite.compbio.jannovar.reference

Class GenomePosition

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.charite.compbio.jannovar.reference.GenomePosition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<GenomePosition>

    public final class GenomePosition
extends Object
implements Serializable, Comparable<GenomePosition>
    Representation of a position on a genome (chromosome, position). Internally, positions are always stored zero-based, but the position type can be explicitely given to the constructor of GenomePosition. In the case of one-based position, pos points to the pos-th base in string from the left when starting to count at 1. In the case of zero-based positions, pos points to the gap left of the character in the case of positions on the forward strand and to the gap right of the character in the case of positions on the reverse strand. When interpreting this for the reverse strand (i.e. counting from the right), the position right of a character is interpreted as the gap before the character. Reverse-complementing a zero-based GenomePosition must be equivalent to reverse-complementing its one-based position representation. Thus, they are shifted towards the right gap besides the character they point at when changing the strand.
    Author:
    Manuel Holtgrewe
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • differenceTo

        public int differenceTo(GenomePosition pos)
        Parameters:
        pos - other position to compute difference to
        Returns:
        the result of (this.pos - pos.pos) (pos is adjusted to the coordinate system and strand of this)
        Throws:
        InvalidCoordinateException - if this and pos are on different chromosomes

      • differenceTo

        public int differenceTo(GenomeInterval itv)
        Parameters:
        itv - interval to compute difference to
        Returns:
        difference to closest base in itv, as would be returned by differenceTo(GenomePosition)), 0 if this lies in itv
        Throws:
        InvalidCoordinateException - if this and itv are on different chromosomes

      • shifted

        public GenomePosition shifted(int delta)
        Return shifted GenomePosition. The position is shifted towards the 3' end of current strand if delta > 0 and towards the 5' end otherwise.
        Parameters:
        delta - the value to add to the position
        Returns:
        the position shifted by delta
